title: Joash’s Reforms and Decline
summary: Joash begins well under Jehoiada’s guidance, repairing the temple. But after Jehoiada’s death, he turns to idolatry. He even kills Jehoiada’s son Zechariah. Later, Joash is wounded in battle and assassinated.

faq.question: What good did Joash do early in his reign?
faq.answer: He repaired the temple and led Judah in worshiping the Lord.

faq.question: What caused Joash’s downfall?
faq.answer: He abandoned God after Jehoiada died and persecuted the faithful.
